definitions.definition: Self-governing. Intelligent, sentient, self-aware, thinking, feeling, governing independently.
Acting on one's own or independently; of a child, acting without being governed by parental or guardian rules.

(Celtic linguistics, of a verb form) Used with no subject, indicating an unknown or unspecified agent; used in similar situations as the passive in English (the difference being that the theme in the English passive construction is the subject, while in the Celtic autonomous construction the theme is the object and there is no subject).
A person who is skilled in or practices radiology.
The rise and fall of the voice in speaking.
The act of sounding the tones of the musical scale.
Singing or playing in good tune or otherwise.
definitions.example: Her intonation was false.

definitions.definition: Reciting in a musical prolonged tone; intonating or singing of the opening phrase of a plain-chant, psalm, or canticle by a single voice, as of a priest.
A thundering; thunder.
A relatively large single payment of money often paid and received instead of, or in addition to, a sequence of smaller payments.
definitions.example: When he retired, he received a lump sum plus a pension.

definitions.definition: The symbol "‐", typically used to join two or more words to form a compound term, or to indicate that a word has been split at the end of a line.
Something that links two more consequential things.
An enclosed walkway or passage that connects two buildings.
Someone who belongs to a marginalized subgroup, and can therefore described by a hyphenated term, such as "German-American", "female-academic", etc.
To separate or punctuate with a hyphen; to hyphenate.
Used to emphasize the coordinating function usually indicated by the punctuation "-".
The stock of competencies, knowledge, habits, social and personality attributes, including creativity, cognitive abilities, embodied in the ability to perform labor so as to produce economic value.
Full of woe; sorrowful; distressed with grief or calamity.
Bringing calamity, distress, or affliction.
definitions.example: a woeful event

definitions.definition: Lamentable, deplorable.
Wretched; paltry; poor.
A Jewish scholar or teacher of halacha (Jewish law), capable of making halachic decisions.
A Jew who is or is qualified to be the leader of a Jewish congregation.
(police) A senior officer who acts as a mentor.
That which decompresses.
A vehicle with seats for two people (a driver or pilot and one passenger)
Related to party politics
Electronic sport
Lack of pertinence; irrelevance.
An instance of this; a moment of being impertinent.
The fact or character of being out of place; inappropriateness.
Insolence; impudence.
An affair; a usually adulterous relationship between people who are not married to each other.
definitions.example: He was involved in a love affair with a married woman.

definitions.definition: A feeling of enthusiasm or strong liking for something; a fondness.
definitions.example: I've always had a love affair with stamps.

definitions.definition: An aircrew.
Heat excited by friction.
Injury or wear caused by friction.
Vexation; irritation of mind; rage.
An expression of opinionated conflict.
To excite heat in by friction; to rub in order to stimulate and make warm.
To excite passion or anger in; to fret; to irritate.
To fret and wear by rubbing.
definitions.example: to chafe a cable

definitions.definition: To rub; to come together so as to wear by rubbing; to wear by friction.
To be worn by rubbing.
definitions.example: A cable chafes.

definitions.definition: To have a feeling of vexation; to be vexed; to fret; to be irritated.
Any of several species of marsupial; usually smaller and stockier than kangaroos
A covering for the head attached to a larger garment such as a jacket or cloak.
A distinctively coloured fold of material, representing a university degree.
An enclosure that protects something, especially from above.
A soft top of a convertible car or carriage.
The hinged cover over the engine of a motor vehicle: known as a bonnet in other countries.
A metal covering that leads to a vent to suck away smoke or fumes.
To cover something with a hood.
Gangster, thug.
Neighborhood.
definitions.example: What’s goin’ down in the hood?

definitions.definition: Relating to inner-city everyday life, both positive and negative aspects; especially people’s attachment to and love for their neighborhoods.
Person wearing a hoodie.
To castrate a male (usually an animal).
To deprive of anything essential; to weaken.
A castrated male horse.
Any castrated male animal.
A eunuch.
The act of reconsidering or something reconsidered
Dizzy or feeling nauseated due to riding in a vehicle; suffering from motion sickness.
Together, acting as one; collectively.
definitions.example: They jointly raised the child, even though they were no longer married.

definitions.definition: Clipping of carburettor / carburetor.
definitions.example: This is what controls the flow of fuel into the carb.

definitions.definition: (nutrition) A sugar, starch, or cellulose that is a food source of energy for an animal or plant.
definitions.example: These microbes are primarily responsible for breaking down cellulose and other carbohydrates into volatile fatty acids (VFAs).

definitions.definition: (by extension, metonym) Any food rich in starch or other carbohydrates.
definitions.example: I'm cutting down on carbohydrates like bread and pasta.

definitions.definition: A small bus or minibus which typically operates service on a fixed route, sometimes scheduled.
An unlicensed taxi cab.
A shared-ride taxi.
A small coin, a nickel.
(in attributive use) Very inexpensive.
An informal lawn bowling or curling competition in which all players present are randomly drawn into teams.
A fraudulent arrangement whereby a broker who has direct access to an exchange executes trades on behalf of a broker who doesn't.
Collectively, the viewers of a television program or other video broadcast
The layer of the Earth's atmosphere that is directly above the stratosphere and directly below the thermosphere.
The part of the Earth's mantle below the asthenosphere and above the outer core.
To put it bluntly, to be outspoken; to speak the truth, to say things as they really are.
A type of small boat, covered over by a surface deck, powered by the occupant or occupants using a double-bladed paddle in a sitting position, from a hole in the surface deck
To use a kayak, to travel or race in a kayak.
definitions.example: Kayaking is an Olympic sport.

definitions.definition: To traverse (a body of water) by kayak.
definitions.example: On a dare, he kayaked the Harlem River in New York from Hell's Gate to Spyten Duyvil.

definitions.definition: Any substance, such as a food or in the form of a medicine which has a laxative effect.
Having the effect of moving the bowels, or aiding digestion and preventing constipation.
Tending to boast or brag.
definitions.example: He wrote a boastful autobiography, recording all his great deeds.

definitions.definition: One who studies theology.
In Roman Catholic usage, a theological lecturer attached to a cathedral church.
A book containing religious prayers
(when capitalized) The Book of Common Prayer
A small holystone
A container in which papers to be dealt with are put.
An electronic folder serving the same purpose.
The aggregate of items that demand one's attention or effort.
definitions.example: The kids, my ex, my parents, the job, bills — my inbox is full.

definitions.definition: To put (something) in someone's inbox.
definitions.example: I just inboxed you the presentation.

definitions.definition: To communicate with (a person) by writing to their electronic inbox.
People suffering from precarity, especially as a social class; people living a precarious existence, without security or predictability, especially job security.
The liquid or solution that has passed through a filter, and which has been separated from the filtride.
To filter.
To shape, form or improve something.
definitions.example: John's in the studio working on the plans for the new house.

definitions.definition: To exercise influence on someone.
definitions.example: Leave it to me. I'll try to work on the boss to give us the day off.

definitions.definition: A female pig.
A female bear, she-bear.
A female guinea pig.
A channel that conducts molten metal to molds.
A mass of metal solidified in a mold.
A contemptible, often fat woman.
A sowbug.
A kind of covered shed, formerly used by besiegers in filling up and passing the ditch of a besieged place, sapping and mining the wall, etc.
To scatter, disperse, or plant (seeds).
definitions.example: As you sow, so shall you reap.

definitions.definition: To spread abroad; to propagate.
To scatter over; to besprinkle.
Possessing political and social views that are considered to be fashionable and left-wing.
A measure; a standard of measure; an instrument to determine dimensions, distance, or capacity; a standard
An act of measuring.
An estimate.
Any instrument for ascertaining or regulating the level, state, dimensions or forms of things
A thickness of sheet metal or wire designated by any of several numbering schemes.
The distance between the rails of a railway.
A semi-norm; a function that assigns a non-negative size to all vectors in a vector space.
The number of stitches per inch, centimetre, or other unit of distance.
Relative positions of two or more vessels with reference to the wind.
definitions.example: A vessel has the weather gauge of another when on the windward side of it, and the lee gauge when on the lee side of it.

definitions.definition: The depth to which a vessel sinks in the water.
(plastering) The quantity of plaster of Paris used with common plaster to make it set more quickly.
That part of a shingle, slate, or tile, which is exposed to the weather, when laid; also, one course of such shingles, slates, or tiles.
A unit of measurement which describes how many spheres of bore diameter of a shotgun can be had from one pound of lead; 12 gauge is roughly equivalent to .75 caliber.
(by extension) A shotgun (synecdoche for 12 gauge shotgun, the most common chambering for combat and hunting shotguns).
A tunnel-like ear piercing consisting of a hollow ring embedded in the lobe.
To measure or determine with a gauge; to measure the capacity of.
To estimate.
To appraise the character or ability of; to judge of.
To draw into equidistant gathers by running a thread through it.
To mix (a quantity of ordinary plaster) with a quantity of plaster of Paris.
To chip, hew or polish (stones, bricks, etc) to a standard size and/or shape.
A group of seven, often a musical group of seven performers.
definitions.example: The Lindsey Septet performs at Carnegie Hall this evening.

definitions.definition: A musical composition for seven instruments or seven voices.
A person who employs, and directs the labour of, temporary or migratory labourers, especially for seasonal agricultural work
The ball of the eye
(CB) a meeting
definitions.example: We had an eyeball last year.

definitions.definition: As a synecdoche, a person's focus of attention
(in the plural) readership or viewership
A favourite or pet; the apple of someone's eye.
To gauge, estimate or judge by eye, rather than measuring precisely; to look or glance at.
definitions.example: A good cook can often just eyeball the correct quantities of ingredients.

definitions.definition: To scrutinize
To stare at intently
definitions.example: Are you eyeballing my girl?

definitions.definition: To roll one's eyes.
Any of various nocturnal insects from the family Myrmeleontidae whose adults resemble damselflies and whose larvae bury themselves under a cone-shaped pit in sand to trap insects such as ants.
A requirement which must be satisfied before taking a course of action.
definitions.example: A marriage licence is a precondition for a wedding.

definitions.definition: To condition in advance
Someone who has accumulated a vast amount of fame; a high-level celebrity.
Teaching children at home instead of sending them to school.
The reduction or the abolition of the military forces and armaments of a nation, and of its capability to wage war.
The act of disarming an opponent in a fight.
A hedge, fence or row of trees positioned to reduce wind damage to crops.
A sheet or stack of material used to protect people or fire from wind.
One who glides through the air in an airship or balloon
Balloonist
A game (originally Chinese) for four players, using a collection of tiles divided into five or six suits.
A solitaire game using the same tiles, where the player wins by removing pairs of matching exposed tiles until none remain.
Father, dad.
(Southeast Asia) Illegal drugs.

A cultural movement that began in Zürich, Switzerland during and as a reaction to World War I and peaked from 1916 to 1920, which primarily involved visual arts, literature (mainly poetry), theatre, and graphic design, and was characterized by deliberate irrationality, disillusionment, cynicism, nihilism, randomness, and rejection of the prevailing standards in art.
A vocalization similar to a cat's purring.
To grimace; to snarl.
To whinge, moan, complain.
To make elaborate unnatural and distorted faces as a form of amusement or in a girning competition.
A wild swine native to Europe and North Africa, Sus scrofa.
An exercise done to improve upper body strength, performed by resting on one's toes and hands and pushing one's weight off the floor.
A push-up bra.
Fraught with danger.
Of uncertain, risky outcome.
Of doubtful or uncertain efficacy, provenance, etc.; dodgy.
Nauseating, rank.
The branch of astronomy or physics that deals with the physical properties of celestial bodies and with the interaction between matter and radiation in celestial bodies and in the space between them.
A confection having a center of ganache and an outer coating of powdered cocoa or chocolate.
Any of various edible fungi, of the genus Tuber, that grow in the soil in southern Europe; the earthnut.
Sad because of a recent disappointment.
Depressed.
(of a horse) Having the crest, or upper part of the neck, hanging to one side.
A form of viewing device that allows the viewer to see things at a different height level and usually with minimal visibility.
: A general or comprehensive view.
To rise and peer around, in the manner of a periscope.
To broadcast live video stream using Periscope app via phone or tablet.
definitions.example: I was periscoping the streets when the protests broke out.  You can't periscope while driving!

definitions.definition: A type of boat raced in Chinese festivals featuring a dragon motif and twenty paddling, one drumming, and one steering known as the sweep.
A card game resembling chemin de fer with many forms - usually entailing the player(s) betting against two or three hands dealt - also bearing some similarities to blackjack.
A woman who jilts a lover.
To cast off capriciously or unfeelingly, as a lover; to deceive in love.
Avian influenza.
A small cut in a surface.
Senses connoting something small.
Often in the expressions in bad nick and in good nick: condition, state.
definitions.example: The car I bought was cheap and in good nick.

definitions.definition: (law enforcement) A police station or prison.
definitions.example: He was arrested and taken down to Sun Hill nick [police station] to be charged.

definitions.definition: To make a nick or notch in; to cut or scratch in a minor way.
definitions.example: I nicked myself while I was shaving.

definitions.definition: To fit into or suit, as by a correspondence of nicks; to tally with.
To make a cut at the side of the face.
To steal.
definitions.example: Someone’s nicked my bike!

definitions.definition: (law enforcement) To arrest.
definitions.example: The police nicked him climbing over the fence of the house he’d broken into.

definitions.definition: To give or call (someone) by a nickname; to style.
A familiar, invented given name for a person or thing used instead of the actual name of the person or thing.
A kind of byname that describes a person by a characteristic of that person.
A nix or nixie.
A day of the week except those which form the weekend; that is:
Any day of the week (Monday through Sunday).
Tidepool
The chief accountant of a company or government.
Any item considered to be of third order.
A tertiary colour.
Something from the Tertiary Period (the former term for the geologic period from 65 million to 2.58 million years ago).
A tertiary feather; a tertial.

A member of a Roman Catholic third order; a layperson who participates in activities similar to those engaged in by men and women who take religious vows (respectively the first and second orders), and who may wear some elements of an order's habit such as a scapular.
Of third rank or order; subsequent.
Possessing some quality in the third degree; especially having been subjected to the substitution of three atoms or radicals.
definitions.example: a tertiary alcohol, amine, or salt

definitions.definition: Of quills: growing on the innermost joint of a bird's wing; tertial.
A sailor.
A mirror inside a vehicle that allows the driver to see the traffic behind
A ball of meat, some variants covered in pastry, which has been fried or barbecued.
A portable, wireless telephone, which changes antenna connections seamlessly during travel from one radio reception cell to another without losing the party-to-party call connection.
